description: Invert transform applied twice to Pascal's triangle A007318.
comments: Triangle T(n,k), 0<=k<=n, read by rows, given by [1, 2, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, ...] DELTA [1, 2, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, ...] where DELTA is the operator defined in A084938 . - Philippe DelÃ©ham (kolotoko(aT)lagoon.nc), Aug 10 2005T(n,k) is the number of sequences of nonempty sequences of nonempty bit strings with n bits and exactly k 1's over all strings in the sequence of sequences.  In other words these are sequences of the structures counted by A055372. - _Geoffrey Critzer_, Apr 06 2013
links: Index entries for triangles and arrays related to Pascal's triangle
formula: a(n, k)=3^(n-1)*C(n, k).O.g.f.: 1/(2 - A(x,y)) where A(x,y) is the o.g.f. for A055372. - _Geoffrey Critzer_, Apr 06 2013
author: _Christian G. Bower_, May 16 2000
